info.author: Paul Hughett
info.description:
Pyvox is a Python extension module for processing volume images, particularly
medical images; it also includes some examples and simple applications.

Features added in release 0.72 include: The interface for constructing
convolution kernels has been completely redesigned and now supports the dynamic
modification of kernels.  Internal types now have min and max attributes which
contain the minimum and maximum possible finite positive values representable in
that type.
info.license:
Similar to BSD, plus provisions for publication credit and prohibiting
diagnostic or medical use.
info.name: Pyvox
info.platform:
Pyvox is written in ANSI C and designed to be easily portable to any Unix or
Posix-compatible platform, including Mac OS X.  Some programs also require the X
Window System.
info.summary: Python extension module for volume image processing
info.html_description:
Pyvox is a Python extension module for processing volume images, particularly medical images; it also includes some examples and simple applications.

Features added in release 0.72 include: The interface for constructing convolution kernels has been completely redesigned and now supports the dynamic modification of kernels. Internal types now have min and max attributes which contain the minimum and maximum possible finite positive values representable in that type.
